Copy link Collaborator fzyzcjy commented Apr 9, 2025 • edited Loading Uh oh! There was an error while loading. Please reload this page . Motivation When I implemented shared experts fusion in llama4, I found this will speedup the loading and reduce cpu memory usage a lot. Modifications Checklist Format your code according to the Code Formatting with Pre-Commit . Add unit tests as outlined in the Running Unit Tests . Update documentation / docstrings / example tutorials as needed, according to Writing Documentation . Provide throughput / latency benchmark results and accuracy evaluation results as needed, according to Benchmark and Profiling and Accuracy Results . For reviewers: If you haven't made any contributions to this PR and are only assisting with merging the main branch, please remove yourself as a co-author when merging the PR. Please feel free to join our Slack channel at https://slack.sglang.ai to discuss your PR. Sorry, something went wrong. Uh oh! There was an error while loading. * [SW-228218]: Fix device mismatch in frequency penalty.

Ensure tensors in BatchedFrequencyPenalizer are on the same device by
moving output_ids and frequency_penalties to the device of
cumulated_frequency_penalties. This resolves a RuntimeError
caused by tensors on cpu and hpu:0 during logits subtraction.

---------

commit_subject: Speedup shared expert weight construction by avoid cloning (#5188)
commit_message: Speedup shared expert weight construction by avoid cloning (#5188)
diff_text:
diff --git a/python/sglang/srt/models/deepseek_v2.py b/python/sglang/srt/models/deepseek_v2.py
index 26c5e617a..2cd64d532 100644
--- a/python/sglang/srt/models/deepseek_v2.py
+++ b/python/sglang/srt/models/deepseek_v2.py
@@ -1628,7 +1628,7 @@ class DeepseekV2ForCausalLM(nn.Module):
                                 f"mlp.experts."
                                 f"{self.config.n_routed_experts + num_repeat}"
                                 f".{suffix}",
-                                weights_dict[shared_expert_weight_name].clone(),
+                                weights_dict[shared_expert_weight_name],
                             )
                         )
                         names_to_remove += [shared_expert_weight_name]
llm_reason: The commit modifies a non-test source code file (deepseek_v2.py) and directly addresses a performance issue by avoiding an unnecessary clone operation when constructing shared expert weights. This change is intended to speed up the operation, fitting the criteria of modifying high-level API code to improve CPU performance. It is not a bug fix, simple refactor, or addition of a new feature, but rather a performance optimization.
llm_api_reason: The commit removes an unnecessary cloning operation when constructing shared expert weights in the DeepseekV2ForCausalLM model. Instead of calling .clone() on the weight tensor, the code now passes the weight directly from the weights dictionary. This change speeds up the weight construction process without altering the model’s external behavior. The affected API is the weight loading interface of DeepseekV2ForCausalLM (specifically within its load_weights implementation).
